results.title: In bed with Madonna = Truth or dare
results.creator_credit: Alek Keshishian, Jay Roewe, Tim Clawson, Boy Toy Inc and Propaganda Films
results.brief_description: Insightful documentary revolving around the singer Madonna on her Blonde Ambition tour, which remarks upon the nature of fame and celebrity culture. Keshishian follows Madonna on tour presenting her magnificently staged live shows (in colour) and her backstage and after hours shenanigans (in black and white). Madonna is depicted as a consummate performer dedicated to her art but whose identity and personhood are inextricably complicated by her infamy and the contemporary superstar obsession. Voice-over from Madonna provides insight into her perspective on fame, family, and creative expression. Interviews include Madonna’s brother, and her numerous dancers, some of whom discuss their ambitions and insecurities. When the camera turns to Warren Beatty (Madonna’s then boyfriend), he proves to be a prickly subject and questions the nature of the honesty of the documentary being made. This work was indeed criticised for it sanitation and artificiality due to the fact that the content was tightly controlled by Madonna. Despite that assertion, Keshishian’s lingering takes provide remarkable material that should prove appealing to those with an interest in contemporary culture, and extremely entertaining to music fans. The film also touches on issues of sexuality, Queer pride, artistic integrity and censorship.

results.title: The Lord of the rings: the fellowship of the ring
results.creator_credit: Peter Jackson, Fran Walsh, Tim Sanders, New Line Cinema and Wingnut Films
results.brief_description: Iconic adaptation of J R R Tolkien’s fantasy epic, “The Lord of the rings: the fellowship of the rings” is the first instalment of the “Rings” trilogy. Director Peter Jackson (Heavenly creatures, The Frighteners, Meet the Feebles) went to incredible lengths to re-create Tolkien’s fantastical vision to the screen, by building extensive realistic sets in his native New Zealand, and by employing a slew of gifted special effects artists. In short, Frodo Baggins, a kind-hearted and earnest hobbit, is entrusted with the gallant mission to return a powerful ring from whence it came - Mount Doom, the only place where it can be destroyed. Failure to do so will result in the destruction of the earth, as the powerful ring is capable of unleashing inestimable evil. Guided by Gandalf, a powerful wizard, Frodo is accompanied on his treacherous journey by three hobbit friends, a dwarf, an elf and several humans. This heroic quest invokes all the necessary thrills of an adventure picture, whilst satiating the exacting standards of an audience inured to CGI wizardry, and gratifying legions of zealous Tolkien fans. With ambitious battle scenes and stupendous set pieces, this grand and masterful cinematic spectacle kept most viewers utterly enthralled, whilst earning Jackson almost universal praise for capturing Tolkien’s mythopoeic narrative and elegiac tone.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

results.title: Jesus Christ superstar (2000)
results.creator_credit: Gale Edwards and Really Useful Films
results.brief_description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice’s rock opera, “Jesus Christ Superstar” is one of the most successful theatrical musicals of all time. The story of Jesus’ Passion is scored to a vibrant, electronic rock beat and is performed by a cast of dancers and singers. This version, following on from Norman Jewison’ 1973 feature film of the same name, is primarily the filming of a stage production, performed in London, 1996-2000. The accent has shifted and stress is now placed on the perspective of Judas, casting him as a man in conflict with Jesus over the direction the cause has taken. Modernisation of the sets and costumes is reflected in the multicultural cast that are dressed in modern garb - including techno gear and Darth Veda-ish masks. The songs however remain the same and it is through their singing that the full tragedy and power of the Passion is realised. Songs include” “Jesus Christ Superstar”, “What’s the Buzz” and “I Don’t Know How to Love Him.” Cast includes Glenn Carter, Jerome Pradon, Renee Castle, Fred Johanson, Rik Mayall, Frederick B. Owens, Michael Shaeffer.

results.title: True lies
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Stephanie Austin and Lightstorm Entertainment
results.brief_description: Harry Tasker is an undercover spy who masquerades to his family as a dull computer salesman. Compounded by Henry’s many inexplicable absences, his wife Helen, feeling neglected and bored with their marriage, turns to sleazy car salesman Simon for excitement. Harry’s latest assignment is on the trail of several missing nuclear warheads that have been stolen by some maniacal Arab terrorists. James Cameron directs here with typical flair for exciting set pieces and a predilection for crude villain/hero and gender stereotypes. Arnold Schwarzenegger embraces the role as the omnipotent and duplicitous Harry who can tackle any form of violence and danger but whose response to a marriage crisis is to kidnap his wife, subject her to a terrifying interrogation, then send her on a bogus assignment as a prostitute. At the time of release the film was read as a cheeky update of the genre, but it offers quite a limited re-imaging of a James Bond type of hero. The best features are the film’s pace and some exciting chase sequences across rooftops and amidst exploding bridges et al. Imbued with generic trademark humour, “True lies” garnered criticism for its cliched representation of Arabic people and an excruciating scene where Helen strips for, (unknowingly), her husband.

results.title: The Funeral
results.creator_credit: Abel Ferrara, Mary Kane and October Films
results.brief_description: Working from an original screenplay from his long time collaborator Nicholas St John, Abel Ferrara’s “The Funeral” sees the maverick director working in a more low key mode. That’s not to say of course that “The Funeral” doesn’t have Ferrara’s usual trademarks; seething violence, spiritual males and cathartic redemption. The film’s melancholic study of a crime family in crisis is set off by the murder of 22 year old Johnny Tempio (Vincent Gallo), shot dead in a movie theatre by a rival gang. His grief stricken brothers (Christopher Walken and Chris Penn) vow bloody revenge, while the women (Annabella Sciorra and Isabella Rossellini) of the family look for a more peaceful resolution. Ferrara is a master of transcending conventional genres as he proved with his bold reinvention of the vampire movie in The Addiction (1995) and his rabid cop drama Bad Lieutenant (1992). Again Ferrara manages to transcend the cliches of the gangster film as the bloody quest for revenge becomes an internal affair, leaving the mafia brothers to contemplate the nature of guilt and the futility of retribution. 1996 Venice Film Festival winner for Best Supporting Actor (Chris Penn) and the OCIC (Organisation Catholique Internationale du Cinema) Award for Abel Ferrara. Cast includes: Benicio del Toro, Gretchen Mol.

results.title: Heavy traffic
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bakshi, Steve Krantz and Film Creations
results.brief_description: Where’s it all going and where does it lead us? What is life all about? Michael, a struggling cartoonist living with his part Italian part Jewish parents is searching for artistic inspiration in the seedy environment around him - a violent, sexually perverse and polluted one. Reclusive and introspective, Michael makes an unsuccessful pitch to get his work off the ground and is forced into numerous disastrous encounters with prostitutes by friends in an attempt to prove his manhood. It’s barkeep Carole who earns his affections however as well as introducing him to a life of crime. Beginning and ending with live action, Bakshi’s film following “Fritz the cat” (1972) is mainly animated in its portrayal of a seedy, disturbing, yet artistically rich milieu of New York City circa 1970s. Cast includes: Joseph Kaufmann, Beverly Hope Atkinson, Frank DeKova, Terri Haven.

results.title: Oliver [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Wolf, Columbia, Romulus Films and Warwick
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: The Muppets take Manhattan [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, David Lazer and Jim Henson
results.brief_description: Kermit and his Muppet theatrical troupe attempt to stage a musical on Broadway, but are shunted around by unscrupulous producers. In desperation the Muppets each go their own way to make a living but reunite when a young producer discovers their script. Kermit, however, comes down with a case of amnesia and emerges as an agency big shot. Miss Piggy, jealous of Kermit’s friendship with a waitress, karate chops him back to reality and it’s “On with the Show”.

results.title: The Looney, looney, looney Bugs Bunny movie
results.creator_credit: Isadore Freleng and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A feature length film containing some of Friz Freleng’s award winning cartoons starring those wonderful cartoon character creations of Freleng’s including Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, Pepe Le Pew, Porky Pig, Daffy Duck, Tweety Pie and Sylvester. The film is presented as part of an Award Ceremony honouring the classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes characters beginning with Bugs Bunny in an Academy Award winning cartoon short “Knighty knight Bugs”. The program is then divided into three acts: Act I - “Satan’s waitin’” starring Yosemite Sam; Act II - “The Unmentionables” starring Bugs Bunny as Elegant Ness, co-starring Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety Pie and Sylvester along with the notorious Rocky and his gang; Act III - The Oswald Awards hosted by Bugs Bunny (a take on the Academy Awards) showing cartoon highlights of the nominees in their starring performances, including Big Bad Wolf and the Three little bops. Classic cartoons, great family entertainment. Majority of voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

The program is then divided into three acts: Act I - “Satan’s waitin’” starring Yosemite Sam; Act II - “The Unmentionables” starring Bugs Bunny as Elegant Ness, co-starring Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety Pie and Sylvester along with the notorious Rocky and his gang; Act III - The Oswald Awards hosted by Bugs Bunny (a take on the Academy Awards) showing cartoon highlights of the nominees in their starring performances, including Big Bad Wolf and the Three little bops. Classic cartoons, great family entertainment. Majority of voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.
description_for_label: A feature length film containing some of Friz Freleng’s award winning cartoons starring those wonderful cartoon character creations of Freleng’s including Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, Pepe Le Pew, Porky Pig, Daffy Duck, Tweety Pie and Sylvester. The film is presented as part of an Award Ceremony honouring the classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes characters beginning with Bugs Bunny in an Academy Award winning cartoon short “Knighty knight Bugs”. The program is then divided into three acts: Act I - “Satan’s waitin’” starring Yosemite Sam; Act II - “The Unmentionables” starring Bugs Bunny as Elegant Ness, co-starring Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety Pie and Sylvester along with the notorious Rocky and his gang; Act III - The Oswald Awards hosted by Bugs Bunny (a take on the Academy Awards) showing cartoon highlights of the nominees in their starring performances, including Big Bad Wolf and the Three little bops. Classic cartoons, great family entertainment. Majority of voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: The Chipmunk adventure
results.creator_credit: Janice Karman, Ross Bagdasarian, Bagdasarian Productions and Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: Join the high-flying adventures of Simon, Theodore and Alvin in their first full length feature movie. The fun begins when Dave leaves the Chipmunks behind when he goes to Europe. Alvin dreams of his own world travel and convinces his brothers to enter a hot air balloon race around the world against the Chipettes. As the two balloons compete for a $100,000 prize, they unwittingly assist a pair of international diamond smugglers. Alvin and the gang get more than their fair share of spills, thrills and excitement backed by a great rock soundtrack sung by the Chipmunks themselves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janice Karman, Ross Bagdasarian, Bagdasarian Productions and Samuel Goldwyn Company
